tags: bravery, freedom, glory, holding-grace, honor, peace, sacrifice, soldier, steps-taken, veterans, war

quote: Rhetorical bombast, music and song resound, banners wave, flowers and colors serve as symbols, and the leaders seek to attach their followers to their own person. Liberalism has nothing to do with all this. It has no party flower and no party color, no party song and no party idols, no symbols and no slogans. It has the substance and the arguments. These must lead it to victory.
author: Ludwig von Mises
tags: anarchy, capitalism, coercion, communism, evil, fascism, free, free-market, freedom, government, laissez-faire, liberalism, libertarian, liberty, nationalism, non-aggression-principle, peace, politics, socialism, society, statism, taxation, theft, trade, voluntaryism, war

quote: Time is valuable in life. You can show someone how much you appreciate them by giving your time. A good amount of time goes by each day. Spending time with the ones you love shows them how much you care.
author: Amaka Imani Nkosazana, Release The Ink
tags: caring, day, giving, giving-and-receiving, happiness, helping, honesty, hope, inspiration, inspirational-quotes, inspirational-words, joy, lessons, life-lessons, life-quotes, love, loving, memories, mindfulness, night, peace, people, philosophy, quotes-to-live-by, sharing, thoughts, time, trust, truth, valuable, values, wisdom, wise-words, words-of-wisdom, words-to-live-by

quote: Resist any form of oppression.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
tags: advice, change, fighting-spirit, freedom, humanity, liberty, mankind, oppression, peace, resist, resistance-to-change, slavery, strength, willpower

quote: In life,You can either play the hand you've been dealt or decide to fold. Just remember that you are not alone in this journey of life. People experience hardships all the time. You learn from those difficult moments and become stronger.
author: Amaka Imani Nkosazana, Release The Ink
tags: difficulties, encouragement, happiness, help, inspiration, inspirational-quotes, inspire, inspiring, joy, life, life-lessons, living, love, peace, quotes, strength, stronger, wisdom, words-of-wisdom, words-to-live-by

quote: Love is the beginning of understanding.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
tags: advice, communication, compassion, humanity, inspirational, kindness, love, peace, understanding, wisdom-o, wise-thoughts

quote: When the power of LOVE is more important than the love of money, religion and power, and people realize that the most important things in this life are NOT things,the world will finally know peace.
author: Tanya Masse
tags: happiness, life-quotes, love, peace, remembrance, veterans

quote: The behaviour and attitude of another person's towards you reflect their state of inner self and mindset.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
tags: attitude, behaviour, change, choices, decision, dont-worry, humanity, inner-self, inspirational, lessons-learnt, life, mankind, mindset, negative, negative-influence, patient, peace, people, wisdom-of-lailah-gifty-akita, wise-words

quote: Don't react to any angry actions, words and behaviours. Keep your quiet spirit, peace and calmness.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
tags: advice, angry, attitude, behavior, behaviours, calm, emotional, humanity, opinions, opinions-lailah-gifty-akita, peace, positive-thinking, spiritual, word-of-wisdom

quote: In the horrors of war, please bring me peace.
author: Anthony Liccione
tags: calmness, chaos, fighting, hate, horror, mindfulness, peace, please, safe-place, safety, tranquility, ugliness, war

quote: We are all human, so we may trespass each other. But there is always grace for forgiveness.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
tags: belief, christian-life, forgiveness, grace, humanity, inspiration, kindness, mankind, mercy, peace, religion, sin, spiritual, wisdom-of-lailah-gifty-akita

quote: Gentleness is a great strength.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
tags: advice, compassionate, endurance, gentle, humanity, humankind, kindness, life, patient, peace, self-help, strength, uplifting, wisdom-of-lailah-gifty-akita, wise-words

quote: With gentleness, you will calm every aggressive action.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
tags: advice, calm, gentle, humanity, peace, wisdom-of-lailah-gifty-akita, wise-words

quote: Islam might not be a challenge for our survival, but when it comes from the Saudis, it really is a concerning problem for the world peace and prosperity.
author: M.F. Moonzajer
tags: challenge, islam, peace, prosperity, saudis, survival

quote: We are sisters. We are brothers. We are family.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
tags: encouragement, faith, family, friendship, gentle, hope, humanity, humankind, inspirational, kindness, life, love, peace, relationship, sharing-life, spiritual, uplifting, wisdom-of-lailah-gifty-akita

quote: Your happiness is my happiness.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
tags: christian-life, daily-life, faith, happiness, hope, humanity, inspirational, inspiring, joy, lailah-gifty-akita-affirmations, life, peace, sharing-life, wise-words

quote: Refuse to react to any angry actions.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
tags: actions, angry, attitude, behaviour, calm, christian-life, faith, hope, humanity, inspirational, lailah-gifty-akita-affirmations, peace, positive-attitude, refuse, resist

quote: We ought to love and be gentle with one another.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
tags: gentle, humanity, inspirational, lailah-gifty-akita-affirmations, love, peace

quote: If you possess a gentle spirit will move mountains.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
tags: determination, encouragement, gentle, peace, positive-thinking, struggles, uplifting, wisdom-of-lailah-gifty-akita, wise-words

quote: Entrepreneurial capitalism takes more people out of poverty than aid.
author: Bono
tags: agorism, anarcho-capitalism, anarchy, ancap, austrian-school-of-economics, free, free-markets, freedom, laissez-faire, libertarian, liberty, market, non-aggression-principle, peace, prosperity, trade, voluntaryism

quote: By portraying war as an opportunity for virtuous acts, the politicians romanticize evil.
author: Sheldon Richman
tags: anarchy, ancap, coercion, following-orders, freedom, government, killing, laissez-faire, libertarian, liberty, military, morality, murder, non-aggression-principle, peace, politics, statism, universal-ethics, voluntaryism, war

quote: Peace is something you only have when your enemy is gone. Either after you have turned him into a friend or vanquished him
author: Bangambiki Habyarimana, The Great Pearl of Wisdom
tags: bad-friends, bad-friendship, enemy, enemy-quotes, friend, friends, friendship-quotes, peace, peace-movement, peace-of-mind, peace-on-earth, peace-quotes, vanquish

quote: If you live your life to please others, sometimes you neglect yourself. You deserve happiness. You deserve peace. You deserve love and respect. Don't get caught up and deprive the very essence of you
author: Amaka Imani Nkosazana, Sweet Destiny
tags: dreams, essence, faith, freedom, friendship, happiness, honesty, hope, inspiration, inspirational-quotes, joy, kindness, love, loving, peace, respect, self-awareness, self-esteem, selfless, trust, truth, wisdom, wise, words-to-live-by, you

quote: Which countries contain the most peaceful, the most moral, and the happiest people? Those people are found in the countries where the law least interferes with private affairs; where government is least felt; where the individual has the greatest scope, and free opinion the greatest influence; where administrative powers are fewest and simplest; where taxes are lightest and most nearly equal, and popular discontent the least excited and the least justifiable; where individuals and groups most actively assume their responsibilities, and, consequently, where the morals of admittedly imperfect human beings are constantly improving; where trade, assemblies, and associations are the least restricted; where labor, capital, and populations suffer the fewest forced displacements; where mankind most nearly follows its own natural inclinations; where the inventions of men are most nearly in harmony with the laws of God; in short, the happiest, most moral, and most peaceful people are those who most nearly follow this principle: Although mankind is not perfect, still, all hope rests upon the free and voluntary actions of persons within the limits of right; law or force is to be used for nothing except the administration of universal justice.
author: Frédéric Bastiat
tags: freedom, government, justice, law, liberty, peace

quote: When you focus your attention more on your dreams and goals and less on the opinions of others, you are capable of achieving success. No one knows the desires of your heart better than you.
author: Amaka Imani Nkosazana, Release The Ink
tags: achieving-success, adversity, attention, dreaming, dreams, faith, focus, goals, happiness, heart, honesty, hope, inspiration, inspirational-quotes, joy, living, love, loving, opinions, passion, peace, self-awareness, self-esteem, success, trust, truth, wisdom, words-of-wisdom, words-to-live-by

quote: A nation that is divided, need love to be united.
author: Victor Dunsin
tags: divided-nation, happiness, life, love, nation, peace, united

quote: You don't blame your shadow for the shape of your body, just the same, don't blame others for the shape of your experience.
author: Gillian Duce
tags: experience, experience-quotes, fearless, fearless-quotes, hope, inspirational, inspirational-quotes, life, life-quotes, living, love, love-quotes, peace, peace-quote, spirituality

quote: A stranger is a friend you have not met before.
author: Quince
tags: friendship, hope, peace

quote: It is wonderful for us to live together in love, in peace and in faith.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita
tags: christian-life, faith, forgiveness, gentle, hope, humanity, inspirational, kindness, lailah-gifty-akita-affirmations, living-together, love, mankind, mercy, peace, peaceful-co-existence, positive-thinking, self-help, wise-words, working-together

quote: There was simply no peace to be had no matter where you hid yourself away. Even in a northern border town of such intensely chaotic oddity and corruption there was still some greater chaos, some deeper insanity, than one had counted on, or could ever be taken into account - wherever there was anything, there would be chaos and insanity to such a degree that one could never come to terms with it, and it was only a matter of time before your world, whatever you thought it to be, was undermined, if not completely overrun, by another world.
author: Thomas Ligotti, Teatro Grottesco
tags: away, chaos, corruption, hide, insanity, oddity, overrun, peace, world

quote: You never know how strong you are until you've been tested. People will try you on every level. They may think because you're not loud or rude like them that you won't put them in their place. But, push the wrong buttons and you'll soon find out.
author: Amaka Imani Nkosazana, Release The Ink
tags: comfort, expression, feelings, freedom, happiness, honesty, hope, inspiration, inspirational-quotes, joy, life, life-lessons, love, loving, peace, philosophy, quotes-to-live-by, truth, wisdom, words-to-live-by

quote: It's useless to disarm the hands, if the heart remains armed
author: Bangambiki Habyarimana, The Great Pearl of Wisdom
tags: disarm, disarmament, disarming, peace, peace-making, peace-movement, peace-of-mind, peace-on-earth, peace-quote, peace-quotes, peaceful-world, peacemaker

quote: We encountered beautiful souls on the travel path.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind
tags: beautiful, co-existence, humanity, journey, lailah-gifty-akita-affirmations, landscapes, mankind, path, peace, people, places, right-places, travel, wonderful

quote: Man will tell woman he will die for her, but I say, tell woman that you will die for her both physically and interior
author: Andrew Smith
tags: brave, chastity, courage, grace, inspirational, life, love, peace

quote: There is no greater peace than work and no greater happiness than progress.
author: Sharad Vivek Sagar
tags: happiness, hardwork, peace, progress, social-entrepreneurship, work

quote: We live in a cruel world, Isabel," he says, without looking at me. "I am only a man, and will not always live up to your expectations. And to me, that is a painful reality. But we must never be cruel to one another. Let there be peace between us.
author: Sylvia Bambola, The Salt Covenants
tags: cruelty, peace

quote: All situations can be resolved peaceful. We should advocate for kindness instead of violence.
author: Mary Sage Nguyen
tags: and-violence, author, compassion, kindness, peace, sweet

quote: The world will know peace when the entrepreneur fully masters the art of starving the politician.
author: Jakub Bożydar Wiśniewski
tags: entrepreneurship, peace, politics

quote: Be gentle with all people. We all have different struggles.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
tags: co-exist, compassion, gentle, inspiring, kindness, mercy, peace, peaceful, struggle

quote: Poetry, will you show me where your words find peace?
author: Delano Johnson, Rare Images of Love
tags: love, peace, poetry

quote: If you want to experience joy and happiness in life, you must free your mind. Don't become a prisoner to your thoughts. Don't allow your perceptions to be the only views you believe. Allow truth to penetrate your core as it sets you free
author: Amaka Imani Nkosazana
tags: awareness, emotions, expression, feelings, freedom, honesty, hope, inspiration, inspirational, inspirational-quotes, joy, kindness, life, living, love, mind, peace, philosophy, quotes-to-live-by, self-awareness, thoughts, trust, truth, wisdom, words-of-wisdom

quote: Sex is a powerful intent to create: the creation of pleasure, creation of love, and ultimately the creation of life. It connects and syncs two beings emotionally, physically, and mentally and is one of the strongest expressions of love that exists in this World.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Being scared to fail inspires creativity; heartbreak inspires creativity; being hurt by others inspires creativity; being lost inspires creativity. Your masterpiece isn’t something that you will have made in the colorful, it is understood in the darkness. Use the anxiety within and let it serve you.
author: Forrest Curran
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Give yourself freedom to grow through love, as love is the most natural direction for humans to grow, just as every tree grows upward towards the sky. Don’t try to control the way that love moves, as any attempt will be futile, for love grows like the branches, wildly growing by the laws of nature, rather than by human rational. Let love grow by her own nature.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: The law of attraction is synonymous to the law of sacrifice, in which you get in return what you are decisively choose to give up. The universe in all her infinity beauty generously opens up gates that you had no idea existed when you close others, but she requires you to walk through the gates solely on your own will and strength, with the other doors that you have left behind often times being forever locked and eternally inaccessible.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Love was never meant to be contained solely in our hearts, just as life in a seed was always meant to break through into the world and become beauty to be shared.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: With the notion that we can open up our world by opening our minds, realize that home is the land that is least explored, and that adventure is a notion not determined by location, but is ultimately a state of mind.
author: Forrest Curran
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: When we fail to tend to the fragilities of a flower as we become distracted by the noise of our minds, our plant is essentially dying. The quintessence of dying in the sense that we are failing to be mindful of the present moment, for life is the paradox of both living and dying concurrently. Just as we are living each moment, we are dying with every moment, and the essence of living is within each breath that ultimately comprises life as a whole.
author: Forrest Curran
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: The universe and the law of attraction speak a language that knows no words, only discerning your intent through sacrifice and what you are willing to give up.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: The tallest and oldest trees that seemed to have just have casually always been there, hold the greatest love: as it nurtures love for others: providing shade for two lovers, becoming home for birds to build a nest, and giving food to the squirrels whom scurry upon it.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: The beauty of traveling is understood along the way rather than at the end of the journey, just as the purpose of marriage isn’t about becoming Mr. and Mrs.’s, but is about the love that is expressed on a daily basis between two lovers. A journey is not made up of the destinations that we arrive at, but is composed within every step and each breath we make.
author: Forrest Curran
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: To commit to the present moment is to accept our inability to control the future and accept that many of our fears and reactions are just what they are, thoughts and emotions that are irrationally internalized. We will never be completely void of the temptations to look into the future when we are in the present; however, one must come to the understanding that by looking too far off into the future, we taint the future by creating an artificial expectation of what the future should hold, and are emotionally drained when it holds something else. Focus on the present, and you will come to have more control over the future naturally.
author: Forrest Curran
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Sometimes people come into our lives to make us a softer person, other times they come to teach us to let go, and occasionally the relationship wasn’t a lesson about the relationship ‘us’, but a lesson about the relationship you have with yourself.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: With maps and globes decorated around your room as a child and with passport and ticket in hand in the present, it is your world to explore. To travel is to ask for a complex mix of the new and the old, hellos and goodbyes, and sadness and happiness. Leave your shoes behind at home and to walk in the footsteps of others for a while.
author: Forrest Curran
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Morality and righteousness is based on intent, love, and in giving; yet, how is it that we as humans have come to view the act of sex with a different set of arbitrary laws? Specifically pigeonholed as an act between man and women, and with righteousness based on an unsystematic number of people we have slept with; as a civilization we have come to bind society with a set of laws largely advantageous to a specific sex, with the minority heavily antagonized and chastised. The universe knows not what sexual morality is, only what is right and wrong. The same principles that dictate morals also command the virtues of sex. Is it with the right intent? Is it based on love? Is it based on giving?
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: There is a specific feeling that comes about during the dying embers of a relationship. Different from the Monday morning quarrels before work because you two are tired, different from the “I’m not going to talk to you for a while because I am mad at you” silences. Breaks ups happen instantly, yet the process occurs over a gradual period of time, with tear by tear until what was once whole, rips into two. Breakups are the disappointment we feel when we wanted our lover to finish the story with an exclamation mark, but instead are left with a question mark.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Nobody thought it could be done, so nobody had tried before. Standing with one foot in the abyss and the other with a foothold in her dreams, she stood on the edge of a cliff. She took one look behind and with one last deep breath, she leapt with reckless certainty and decisive confidence. Blurring through the sky, for a moment she looked like she would fade into darkness, but in the very last moment when everyone else had given up on her, from her back spread wings. With a leap of faith, she learned to fly.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Your life is your artwork and you are to paint life as a beautiful struggle. With your brush, paint the colors of joy in vibrant shades of red. Color the sky a baby blue, a color as free as your heart. With rich, earthy tones shade the valleys that run deep into the ground where heaven meets hell. Life is as chaotic as the color black, a blend of all colors, and this makes life a beautiful struggle. Be grateful for the green that makes up the beautiful canvas, for nature has given you everything that you need to be happy. Most of all, don’t ever feel the need to fill the entire canvas with paint, for the places left blank are the most honest expressions of who you are.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Sure, the Leaning Tower of Pisa leaned like everyone else said it would, the mountains of Tibet were more beautiful than you had ever expected, and the Pyramids of Egypt stood mysteriously in the sea of sand like in the pictures; yet is it the environment or rather the openness in mindset, that makes up the elusive essence of happiness that we experience when we travel?
author: Forrest Curran
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Is the sunrise of Mount Fuji more beautiful from the one you see in the countryside a bit closer to home? Are the beaches of Indonesia really that much more serene than those we have in our own countries? The point I make is not to downplay the marvels of the world, but to highlight the notion of the human tendency in our failure to see the beauty in our daily lives when we take off the travel goggles when we are home. It is the preconceived notion of a place that creates the difference in perception of environments rather than the actual geological location.
author: Forrest Curran
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: When we are in a foreign country we live with a fervor rooting from knowing that our days there are numbered, yet if the number of days in lives is numbered, are we not to live our everyday lives with that same zeal?
author: Forrest Curran
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Sacrifice is a terribly difficult thing to do, of which you will be asked to do many times along your path. Only with genuine love will you be able to make these sacrifices because often times you will simply want to refuse the sacrifices that the universe asks of you to make. When you close one door, another opens; that is how the universe works and through sacrifice we are given the keys to the next door in life.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Although the future is indiscernible, we often feel the need to plan for what cannot be planned, and attempt to react to things that never happened. Our overemphasis in the future is a mere illusion, which often makes us foolishly blind to the beauty of the present moment, and is the root of creating the worst case scenarios and the what- if situations that plague the mind.
author: Forrest Curran
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Allowing both negative and positive thoughts to arise in life and acknowledging them for what they are, a secondary reaction within to what is happening outside, we grant our emotions free passage within without allowing external influences to impede our personal happiness. We cannot have control over everything that occurs in life, but that is simply not the goal, for we have control only over our relationship that we have with life.
author: Forrest Curran
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Whether between man and women, man and man, or woman and woman; look not towards any system that binds society created by man for guidance, but be guided by the principles of love. Love is the only law that commands this universe, and is the only language that is understood universally.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: The journey is made up of the most genuine and honest wonders of the mind, but also includes unfathomable sorrow and despair; yet, this is what makes up a journey as well as the human experience in entirety.
author: Forrest Curran
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Your value and self-worth is not found in your former lover, not in the loving words of they spoke, not in the gentle ways that they held you, not in the sweetness of their kiss; but found in the love that you have for yourself.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Not basing your principles of sex based on the judgment of other or on hearsay, uphold yourself to virtues that you believe in. Before any laws created by man, religion, and culture; the universe has always held us under the principles of love in all endeavors in life, and this applies to sex as well. Sex is a very personal experience and the morals you follow under this act are a personal notion that you create yourself for the sake of your personal happiness.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Our journey is our breath that makes up the seconds, the emotions that are in the minutes, and our purpose that make up the hours. Stay true to yourself in each moment, and remain vigilant to your purpose in every instant. Our journey begins with the first breath and thereby by every breath that follows.
author: Forrest Curran
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: The drive, the ambition, the art; it all comes to me when I close my eyes and think about the sacrifices my Mom made for me.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Tomorrow, today will be yesterday, and tomorrow will be today. By the nature of time when tomorrow will shift to become today, we demystify the notion that we are powerless in the face of the future, as the future will become the present moment naturally. On the basis that tomorrow will also eventually become yesterday, we can fundamentally note that time converges through yesterday, today, and tomorrow to where the essence of our very existence converges in the present moment.
author: Forrest Curran
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: At times we will be asked to let go of things that we have always wanted to keep for ourselves, or things that we would never have thought that we would to have to let go of, such as the loss of a loved one or the betrayal of a dear friend. A tree never hesitates to shake off her leaves during fall, and so we must take another lesson given to us by the nature: let go when it is time. Although such losses can be difficult and painful, rise above this suffering. Focus within your mind, the image of the Lotus prospering above mud. We are the lotus; rise above.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: buddha, inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: The Lotus in Buddhism is a sacred symbol that represents purity and resurrection as attributes that develop through a spiritual awakening of the self. With humble beginnings in swamplands, the Lotus flower exquisitely blooms, pure and untainted, from this murky world it thrives in. The Lotus flower represents a higher state of mind, a strong spirit cultivated far from the suffering and temptations of this muddied world that personifies beauty through the present moment.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: If you want to be free of the wars of the world, begin by resolving the wars within you. If you want to see the world at peace, create peace within your mind.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Let the people talk, let people doubt, and letpeople question you, but never allow yourself to quit walking your path. Their path is their own and the path you walk is that of your own. Sweet child of mine, be the brave child of mine.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Synchronize each breath with the present moment and become intertwined with happiness. Breathing in, we are grateful for the opportunities that are given to us; breathing out, we let go of the depression and anxiety that hold us back.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Have no fear in the devil and acknowledge the insecurities, mistakes of the past, and disappointments that you have long failed to accept as new beginnings and see the child within you begin to heal.
author: Forrest Curran
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Plunging into the depths of hell, re-opening the gates to wounds and emotions that we have long tried to keep sealed and locked within, we discover that that the devil is not the Herculean ruler of darkness that we had imagined, but only a vulnerable and devastated child. With honesty and without judgment, we must muster the courage to meet this innocent child with whom we have come to label as the devil.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Breathe in, breathe out. Without the fire, the phoenix never rises from the ashes. Let the fire scorch the skin and burn the soul, allowing yourself to absorb the pain and understand the sincerity of the pain. Breathe in, you are not the past, you are not the future; breathe out, you are simply each breath, the present moment. As you breathe in and breathe out, acknowledge all the trials you have overcome thus far, and that you can continue to overcome all else without doubt. Breathe in, breathe out.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Hell is not a place, but a state of mind born from stress. Hell holds our insecurities, our fears, and it is ultimately the domicile of the devil within. The devil breathes and thrives in the fragment of our hearts that we dare not visit; yet, we can only make peace with ourselves by diving into the pits of hell and having an honest conversation with the devil himself.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: In life hard times will befall you that will create doubt in yourself, and life will ask questions of the authenticity of the person you are. Carrying the lotus means being true to yourself and in the realization that you were always meant to grow above this mud. We are meant to grow, progress, and evolve in this relentless environment of the World and through it all achieve happiness with grace in letting go. Carry the Lotus within; grow and rise above from the harsh and remorseless world beneath you.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: All is contained within the silence of death, the quietest and the loudest sound in the universe.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Love is a seed that we diligently plant and requires tender care and watering in order for the tree to ever grow. Just as we cannot foresee the future and what is to become of this love later in life, the tree cannot tell what the weather will be like in the future. The strongest of winds and pouring rain may befall on the tree, however as long as the foundation and roots remains strong, love is able to exist.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: I didn’t know that the times we spent together on the weekends, the times that we laughed together, and the times you helped me out was your way of silently wishing me a beautiful goodbye.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: What initially began as a couple of pieces that fitted together from first dates, slowly expands with time and for a moment the puzzle actually looks like it will be realized. Heartbreak is when the puzzle is nearly finished and you suddenly realize that pieces are missing. Perhaps they were never in the box in the first place or perhaps they went missing along the way; regardless, the puzzle remains undone. You frantically search the box and your surroundings, desperately trying to find the missing pieces, anxiously looking to fill the void, but you search for what cannot be found.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Freedom from stress, freedom from anxiety, freedom from depression; freedom is autonomy from all that stagnates growth in this ever complex and noisy world. By the fear of being in the unknown, we often overlook and forget the serene view of being on the raft: the glowing virgin stars, the gentle ways that the waves moves, and the endless possibilities that exist under the sun. The fundamental principle of freedom is to be lost and our state of mind never differs too far from this analogy of being stranded in the middle of the ocean.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Breathe in, breathe out. All the blessings of the universe that we may overlook are contained in the entirety of a breath. Breathe in, breathe out. Each breath is the sun flowering our earth, fresh water filling our oceans, and the blue skies clearing our minds. Infinite emotions are contained within every breath, and by the breath we can always realize the beauty within it all. Breathe in, breathe out.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Only in the moments of being alone in the darkness on the raft, will you have the space to speak, listen, and to act from the heart. Only in the moments of pain, do we begin to empathize with humankind. Only when you are lost, you will find new meaning. Float on.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Do not desperately seek refuge in heaven and delve in blissful ignorance
author: discover the fires and infernos of hell that have sprung inside of you.
tags: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love

quote: I wonder if the world’s fascination has less to do with the flower itself, and more with the muck that it flourishes in. The Lotus flower is of an unparalleled beauty in its elegance and grace, yet its’ origins are of an environment that is a stark contrast. We cannot help but ponder such strange juxtaposition. However, there is something telling in this natural contrast between the flower and its environment: we are meant to grow, like the Lotus, and not dirty our hands in the mud that surrounds us.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Life was the gift that you were given the day you were born, and in turn you are the gift to life. Only in the moments of being alone in the darkness on the raft, will you have the space to speak, listen, and to act from the heart.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: By creating an image of low self- esteem within ourselves, we bomb and terrorize our true self. When we refuse to forgive, we create an insensible war from old grudges. When we allow stress to impede our healthy flow of energy, we create the weapon of destruction that kills humanity.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Although at times you might want to detract from the path, realize that how you treat yourself becomes the foundation as to how you treat others; although we may want to resort to violence in words during conflict, understand that how you speak to others becomes the basis of how you speak to yourself; although we may want to give up; do not be fooled in the idea that ease and comfort is where your true path lies.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Acknowledge and accept that there will be chaotic times while being on your raft from being lost in true freedom. Engulfed by darkness at sea, we are consumed by a great loneliness that has consistently existed even when people surrounded us, and that is when we must throw all that is heavy into the water, and float independently through to the present.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Without the fear of occasional gaffes, the willingness to be perfectly imperfect, and the heart of a child who creates chaos first thing in the morning for a parent; you are not allowing our inner child to grow. You grow in pain, not in years, and you must cross the bridge without knowing of the pain, the tears, or the trials and tribulations that you will come to have to face, but sweet child of mine, stay the happy child of mine.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: With nowhere to go, we have everywhere else to go.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Without waiting for others acknowledge your purpose, remaining balanced when things don’t work out, and uncompromising in your effort; realize that you have a piece of the universe for which she cannot exist without.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Wisdom comes from not only in the understanding that often times we say no to things too easily and quickly, but also in knowing that that ‘no’ for the sake of your physical and mental wellbeing can also be a reasonable and grounded decision for which you shouldn’t feel the need to feel guilty.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Apples to oranges, the act of comparing your life to another’s is more like comparing an elephant to an apple, it makes no sense to compare someone’s life that you have no knowledge about to that of your own, of which in all earnest is not something that you completely understand yourself.
author: Forrest Curran, Purple Buddha Project: Purple Book of Self-Love
tags: inspirational, motivational, peace, philosophy, spiritual, wisdom, zen

quote: Peace of Man"Greet each man with words of loveAnd peace,And a dove will be placedOn an olive tree.Leave a man with feelingsOf betrayalOr envy,And a dove gets shotOff the olive tree.Greet each man with peace,And leave each man with love.Ask yourself -One more enemy,Or one more dove?Always choose love.It's time for everybody toSpeak love.Let's fill the trees with doves,And spread the leaves of love.So,Always addAnd never subtractAnother peace of manFrom the olive tree.

quote: It must be remembered that a vast majority of mankind’s history has been spent living under the rule of tyrants and authoritarians. quote: I can be happy or unhappy in all situations. I am sure of it, because I have been. I have felt distraught and joyful in situations of abundance as well as poverty, in situations of popularity and anonymity, in situations of success and failure. The difference was never based on the situation itself, but always on my state of mind and heart. When I knew I was walking with God, I always felt happy and at peace. When I was entangled in my own complaints and emotional needs, I always felt restless and divided.
author: Henri J.M. Nouwen
tags: happypoverty, henri-nouwen, joy, peace, peace-of-mind, peacefulness, walking-with-god

quote: God speaks to you all the time ~ Have you tuned in to the cosmic vibrations of love, harmony, peace, and truth? Unless you quieten that blabbering little mind of yours, you won’t be able to listen to the Divine music that plays on and on...Just for one heavenly second, shut your eyes, ears, and mind to the cacophonous noises of this physical, illusionary, temporary world. Exit all the drama.Just for that one heavenly second, stay quiet and simply listen. Listen to the ambrosial sound. It vibrates with joy.You can have more of this soulful peace in your life, if only you choose to align yourself with the Source of Love and Light. The more you stay attuned to "Home", the less you’d wander in-vain.

quote: As a writer, It’s an elation to see my own words in print, to float them out there for all the world to read and to learn that some of the world actually does read them. Of their own free will! It warms the heart. However, I have learnt that in spite of frequent and sound advice, the world has not become a noticeably more peaceful kingdom. Folly abounds, incompetence, wrath, crime, nonsense prevails, thieves multiply, power corrupts. And my bones creak in the morning. Still, spectacular things go on in the sky; forms and colors and movements, cloud shapes and sunscapes so awesome I ought to end everyday standing on a rooftop and clapping and calling for more. Slowly I learn bits of what there is to see, and then forget and learn again. And learn too that mortality is the stuff of life; learn how soon the young get old, how short a while is for ever. It’s sad to stand on the hill and, one by one, see the lights go out around you; sad to know the paper has begun turning yellow before the pencil gets to the bottom of the page, to realize there won’t be time enough to get it all done – the chores, the cooking, the sitting on the porch to watch the birds dart at dusk, the major work. But there’s something reassuring too in understanding that death is nature’s, life’s, God’s way of letting us know that we are never meant to save the world single-handedly, to keep the sun aloft and the old globe spinning. What we’re meant to do, I hope, is fill some small and temporary slot, to give off a little light for a little while and then lie down. I’m comfortable with that, with the notion of being a small voice yapping away in a small planet. One of many voices, neither the wisest, nor the best, but mine, and fairly close to as good as I can make it.
author: Manasa Rao
tags: nature, nature-s-beauty, peace, world, writer

quote: We can kill all of the terrorist, but that will not solve the problem of terrorism. By reducing or eliminating fundamentalism we may be able to reduce terrorism. Open your eyes and look at the world. Fundamentalism is a prison for the human mind where no free thinking can be done. In that prison, the mind will stagnate and degenerate. The mind works in a very different way. It wants to get out. When that imprisoned mind can’t get out, it becomes more fundamentalist and it wants to take revenge. Terrorism is the weapon of fundamentalism.

quote: The mind is deeper than the horizon, bigger than the universe, and more mysterious than space.

quote: We can never live in the past
author: so everyday we begin anew.

quote: Most difficult problems become very easy when we learn how to put things into perspective.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, how-to-deal-with-problems, inspirational, philosophy, problems, put-things-into-perspective, quotes

quote: The most powerful force on earth is residing in your heart
author: it is your power of love.

quote: Initially, the truth may hurt, but lies hurt always.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, lies, lies-hurt, philosophy, quotes, truth, truth-may-hurt

quote: Life is not a destination to be reached, but it is a journey to be enjoyed.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, enjoy-life, inspirational, life, life-is-a-journey, life-is-not-a-destination, philosophy, quotes

quote: True freedom comes only from true wisdom.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, freedom, inspirational, philosophy, quotes, true-freedom, true-wisdom, wisdom

quote: There is no right or wrong
author: only our thoughts and perceptions make it so.
tags: Debasish Mridha

quote: A poet is a silent singer
author: he sings the deep songs of the soul silently.
tags: Debasish Mridha

quote: To be a success, dream with open eyes, have faith in your defined purpose, and act with deep love.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, dream, faith, how-to-be-a-success, inspirational, love, philosophy, purpose, quotes, success

quote: On the way toward success, obstacles are the barrier to build the power of the mind.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, obstacles-of-success, philosophy, power-of-the-mind, quotes, success

quote: A wise person is silent and rarely wants to show his wisdom. A fool is always vocal and uses every opportunity to show his foolishness.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, foolishness, fools, inspirational, philosophy, quotes, wisdom, wise-person

quote: Your path should be lighted with love and trust, your purpose should be clear, and your goal should be the light post.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, goals, having-a-goal, inspirational, love, philosophy, quotes, trust

quote: Do not let your problems become a burden and interfere with your endless possibilities.

tags: burdens, debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, do-not-let-your-problems, endless-possibilities, inspirational, philosophy, problems, quotes

quote: Have an intention, take action, and then learn on the way to success.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, how-to-be-a-success, inspirational, philosophy, quotes, success, take-action

quote: Life becomes empty if we fill it with worthless thoughts and deeds.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, deeds, inspirational, life, philosophy, quotes, thoughts, worthless-thoughts-and-deeds

quote: Stop complaining. Plot your course and start your journey. Adjust your sail. Success is waiting to welcome you.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: adjust-your-sail, debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, philosophy, quotes, start-your-journey, stop-complaining, success, success-is-waiting

quote: I am burning within with an immeasurable, indescribable endless joy of life.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, endless-joy, inspirational, joy, joy-of-life, life, philosophy, quotes

quote: A tree is more conscious than we are; she expresses her awareness slowly and silently with beauty. Our consciousness is very limited, but we are blessed with a language to express or superficial consciousness.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: conscious, consciousness, debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, our-consciousness-is-limited, philosophy, quotes, theory-of-consciousness

quote: Love is the greatest gift of life. Those who give and receive are blessed with the ecstasy of life.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: If you can think independently, you are the master of this universe.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, independence, inspirational, master-of-this-universe, philosophy, quotes, think-independently

quote: Happiness is an awareness—a blissful perception, not in ownership or in material possessions.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: When you achieve higher consciousness you will not achieve anything, but you will lose everything that is not important and is not yours.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: achieve-higher-consciousness, consciousness, debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, philosophy, quotes, theory-of-consciousness

quote: Consciousness is the awareness of the interaction and interdependence among mind, body, spirit, and the universe where it resides.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Teach a child not to seek help but to seek the opportunity to help others.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, help-others, how-to-raise-a-child, inspirational, opportunity, philosophy, quotes, teach-a-child

quote: You can be kind only when you are in love.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, in-love, inspirational, kind, kindness, love, philosophy, quotes

quote: Our awareness about ourselves and the world around us is so limited that we are ready to destroy ourselves. For the survival of humanity, an evolution of consciousness is essential.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, evolution-of-consciousness, importance-of-consciousness, inspirational, philosophy, quotes, theory-of-consciousness

quote: Love as if you were created by the universe just to love.

quote: Life is absolutely impossible without love.

quote: It is not the duration but the donation of life that matters the most.

tags: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, donation-of-life, duration-of-life, inspirational, philosophy, quotes, what-matters-in-life

quote: Be an example and open a new way for life.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: It is not the success, but it is the failures that make us stronger and more resilient.

author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Dare to love and get lost in yourself.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: dare-to-love, debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, get-lost-in-yourself, inspirational, love, philosophy, quotes

quote: Every thing—every atom is conscious. To find it we have to open our eyes and see with a higher consciousness.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: consciousness, debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, every-atom-is-conscious, higher-level-of-consciousness, inspirational, philosophy, quotes

quote: We are the flower of eternal consciousness.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: consciousness, debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, eternal-consciousness, flower-of-eternal-consciousness, inspirational, philosophy, quotes

quote: Be an encourager not a pacifier.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: be-an-encourager, debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, don-t-be-a-pacifier, encouragement, encourager, inspirational, pacifier, philosophy, quotes

quote: There are many levels of consciousness, but atomic consciousness or universal consciousness is the basis of all other levels of consciousness. A tree is very much conscious even though in our point of view they are not conscious.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: consciousness, debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, levels-of-consciousness, philosophy, quotes, theory-of-consciousness, universal-consciousness

quote: Music is the primordial language of life. That is why we love it so much. Actually every animal can hear and understand music better than we do.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: animals-and-music, debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, hearing-music, inspirational, language-of-music, music, philosophy, quotes

quote: Consciousness is basic while thoughts are supreme. Speeches are nothing but the expression of thoughts and feelings. If there is no consciousness, nothing else could be there. At the same time, all forms of consciousness will not give the abilities to think and express thoughts.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: ability-to-think, consciousness, debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, definition-of-consciousness, express-thoughts, inspirational, philosophy, quotes, theory-of-consciousness

quote: Life is a gift, but living is a choice.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, life-is-a-gift, life-motto, living-is-a-choice, philosophy, profound-thought, quotes

quote: Consciousness is nothing but a neuro-chemical and a mechanical action of the body. Consciousness is important, but the expression of thoughts with language makes us human. Everything is conscious, but levels of consciousness are different.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: consciousness, debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, definition-of-consciousness, inspirational, philosophy, quotes, theory-of-consciousness

quote: As water changes its shape according to the shape of the vessel, I change myself by changing my thoughts.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: adapting-to-your-situation, changing-my-thoughts, changing-myself, debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, how-to-change-your-life, inspirational, philosophy, quotes

quote: When I am ready for the opportunity, I get lucky.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, how-to-get-lucky, inspirational, luck, opportunity, philosophy, quotes, ready-for-opportunity

quote: Smile to lighten up.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, lighten-up, philosophy, power-of-a-smile, quotes, smile

quote: Everything has a consciousness. Every atom and molecule is conscious. Every virus and bacteria is conscious. Every tree, large and small animals are conscious, but each level of consciousness is different. All humans are conscious; the level of consciousness among humans also differs.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, definition-of-consciousness, inspirational, levels-of-consciousness, philosophy, quotes, theory-of-consciousness

quote: When I tried to understand consciousness, I found out how simple it was, but we try to make it so complicated.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: consciousness, debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, philosophy, quotes, understanding-consciousness

quote: The level of consciousness determines the deepness of thoughts and the awareness of the beauty of life.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: awareness-of-life, consciousness, debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, deepness-of-thoughts, inspirational, philosophy, quotes

quote: Forgiveness is a process of accepting the past and welcoming the mysterious beauty of the future.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: accept-the-past, debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, forgiveness, future, inspirational, mysterious-beauty, philosophy, quotes, welcome-the-future

quote: You are intelligent if you know what you do not know.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, definition-of-intelligent, inspirational, intelligent, philosophy, quotes

quote: Music is the language of the universe. Music was there even before the concept of life. Music is one of the most powerful catalysts of evolution.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, language-of-music, language-of-the-universe, music, music-is-powerful, philosophy, quotes

quote: Sleeping is not a loss of consciousness, but it is a temporary loss of integration of awareness.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: consciousness, debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, integration-of-awareness, philosophy, quotes, sleeping-and-consciousness

quote: The consciousness of an embryo is the universal consciousness. What we learn after birth is awareness and egocentric consciousness that we call the mind. Everyday we learn to conform to the beauty, tragedy, and adversity of this world and that forms our judgmental mind.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: consciousness, debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, definition-of-consciousness, how-does-the-mind-develop, inspirational, judgmental-mind, philosophy, quotes, what-is-consciousness

quote: Breath is the bridge that connects us with the mysteries of the universe and universal consciousness.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: consciousness, debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, mysteries-of-the-universe, philosophy, quotes, universal-consciousness

quote: As we transcended and transformed from Neanderthal so will future humans transcend to a new level of consciousness and transform into a super human or homo-cosmicus.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: consciousness, debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, evolution-of-consciousness, human-transformation, inspirational, new-level-of-consciousness, philosophy, quotes

quote: Our learned egocentric and judgmental consciousness is the source of unhappiness; however, universal consciousness is always blissful.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: consciousness, debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, egocentric, inspirational, judgmental, philosophy, quotes, universal-consciousness

quote: What we call spirit is our universal consciousness. We can also call it atomic consciousness. Every atom is conscious and knows everything that is going on around it at every moment.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: atomic-consciousness, atoms, debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, philosophy, quotes, theory-of-consciousness, universal-consciousness, what-is-a-spirit

quote: Consciously or unconsciously, the only person you should compete with is you.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: competing-with-others, debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, inspirational, philosophy, quotes

quote: Consciousness is a magic of our brain and an illusion of our mind.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: consciousness, debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, illusion-of-the-mind, inspirational, magic-of-the-brain, philosophy, quotes

quote: To solve a problem, change your awareness, perception, and consciousness about the problem.
author: Debasish Mridha
tags: change-your-awareness, consciousness, debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, how-to-approach-a-problem, how-to-solve-a-problem, inspirational, perception, philosophy, quotes

quote: The marks humans leave are too often scars.
author: John Green, The Fault in Our Stars
tags: humans, pain, scars

quote: Numbing the pain for a while will make it worse when you finally feel it.
author: J.K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
tags: pain

quote: The worst part of holding the memories is not the pain. It's the loneliness of it. Memories need to be shared.
author: Lois Lowry, The Giver
tags: loneliness, memories, pain, share

quote: There are wounds that never show on the body that are deeper and more hurtful than anything that bleeds.
author: Laurell K. Hamilton, Mistral's Kiss
tags: depression, pain, trauma

quote: Some old wounds never truly heal, and bleed again at the slightest word.
author: George R.R. Martin, A Game of Thrones
tags: hurt, pain, perfect, truthful

quote: Imagine smiling after a slap in the face. Then think of doing it twenty-four hours a day.
author: Markus Zusak, The Book Thief
tags: pain, sadness, stoicism

quote: One thing you can't hide - is when you're crippled inside.
author: John Lennon
tags: beatles, emotions, hypocrisy, pain, suffering

quote: I have absolutely no pleasure in the stimulants in which I sometimes so madly indulge. It has not been in the pursuit of pleasure that I have periled life and reputation and reason. It has been the desperate attempt to escape from torturing memories, from a sense of insupportable loneliness and a dread of some strange impending doom.
author: Edgar Allan Poe
tags: addiction, alchohol, drinking, drugs, loneliness, melancholy, pain

quote: Once upon a midnight dreary, while I pondered, weak and weary,Over many a quaint and curious volume of forgotten lore,While I nodded, nearly napping, suddenly there came a tapping,As of some one gently rapping, rapping at my chamber door.Tis some visitor," I muttered, "tapping at my chamber door — Only this, and nothing more."Ah, distinctly I remember it was in the bleak December,And each separate dying ember wrought its ghost upon the floor.Eagerly I wished the morrow; — vainly I had sought to borrowFrom my books surcease of sorrow — sorrow for the lost Lenore —For the rare and radiant maiden whom the angels name Lenore — Nameless here for evermore.And the silken sad uncertain rustling of each purple curtainThrilled me — filled me with fantastic terrors never felt before;So that now, to still the beating of my heart, I stood repeating,Tis some visitor entreating entrance at my chamber door —Some late visitor entreating entrance at my chamber door; — This it is, and nothing more."Presently my soul grew stronger; hesitating then no longer,Sir," said I, "or Madam, truly your forgiveness I implore;But the fact is I was napping, and so gently you came rapping,And so faintly you came tapping, tapping at my chamber door,That I scarce was sure I heard you"— here I opened wide the door; — Darkness there, and nothing more.Deep into that darkness peering, long I stood there wondering, fearing,Doubting, dreaming dreams no mortals ever dared to dream before;But the silence was unbroken, and the stillness gave no token,And the only word there spoken was the whispered word, "Lenore?"This I whispered, and an echo murmured back the word, "Lenore!" — Merely this, and nothing more.Back into the chamber turning, all my soul within me burning,Soon again I heard a tapping somewhat louder than before.Surely," said I, "surely that is something at my window lattice:Let me see, then, what thereat is, and this mystery explore —Let my heart be still a moment and this mystery explore; — 'Tis the wind and nothing more."Open here I flung the shutter, when, with many a flirt and flutter,In there stepped a stately raven of the saintly days of yore;Not the least obeisance made he; not a minute stopped or stayed he;But, with mien of lord or lady, perched above my chamber door —Perched upon a bust of Pallas just above my chamber door — Perched, and sat, and nothing more.Then this ebony bird beguiling my sad fancy into smiling,By the grave and stern decorum of the countenance it wore.Though thy crest be shorn and shaven, thou," I said, "art sure no craven,Ghastly grim and ancient raven wandering from the Nightly shore —Tell me what thy lordly name is on the Night's Plutonian shore!" Quoth the Raven, "Nevermore."Much I marveled this ungainly fowl to hear discourse so plainly,Though its answer little meaning— little relevancy bore;For we cannot help agreeing that no living human beingEver yet was blest with seeing bird above his chamber door —Bird or beast upon the sculptured bust above his chamber door, With such name as "Nevermore.
author: Edgar Allan Poe, The Raven
tags: hopelessness, pain

quote: Behind every beautiful thing, there's some kind of pain.
author: Bob Dylan
tags: beautiful, behind, kind, of, pain, thing

quote: You care so much you feel as though you will bleed to death with the pain of it.
author: J.K. Rowling, Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
tags: grief, harry-potter, hurt, pain

quote: Did you really want to die?""No one commits suicide because they want to die.""Then why do they do it?""Because they want to stop the pain.
author: Tiffanie DeBartolo, How to Kill a Rock Star
tags: intent, pain, suicide

quote: The worst type of crying wasn't the kind everyone could see--the wailing on street corners, the tearing at clothes. No, the worst kind happened when your soul wept and no matter what you did, there was no way to comfort it. A section withered and became a scar on the part of your soul that survived. For people like me and Echo, our souls contained more scar tissue than life.
author: Katie McGarry, Pushing the Limits
tags: crying, depression, grief, hurt, pain, sadness

quote: Mental pain is less dramatic than physical pain, but it is more common and also more hard to bear. The frequent attempt to conceal mental pain increases the burden: it is easier to say “My tooth is aching” than to say “My heart is broken.
author: C.S. Lewis, The Problem of Pain
tags: depression, pain

quote: You," he said, "are a terribly real thing in a terribly false world, and that, I believe, is why you are in so much pain.
author: Emilie Autumn, The Asylum for Wayward Victorian Girls
tags: pain

quote: Another secret of the universe: Sometimes pain was like a storm that came out of nowhere. The clearest summer could end in a downpour. Could end in lightning and thunder.
author: Benjamin Alire Sáenz, Aristotle and Dante Discover the Secrets of the Universe
tags: pain, storm, summer

quote: But who can remember pain, once it’s over? All that remains of it is a shadow, not in the mind even, in the flesh. Pain marks you, but too deep to see. Out of sight, out of mind.
author: Margaret Atwood, The Handmaid's Tale
tags: memory, pain

quote: If you are distressed by anything external, the pain is not due to the thing itself, but to your estimate of it; and this you have the power to revoke at any moment.
author: Marcus Aurelius, Meditations
tags: attitude, distress, mind-over-body, pain, stoicism

quote: I can bear any pain as long as it has meaning.
author: Haruki Murakami, 1Q84
tags: pain

quote: Don't be scared...Women can handle the worst kind of pain. You'll find out one day.
author: Gayle Forman, If I Stay
tags: pain

quote: Forgiveness has nothing to do with absolving a criminal of his crime. It has everything to do with relieving oneself of the burden of being a victim--letting go of the pain and transforming oneself from victim to survivor.
author: C.R. Strahan
tags: forgiveness, pain, self-perception, survivor, victim

quote: The unendurable is the beginning of the curve of joy.
author: Djuna Barnes, Nightwood
tags: pain

quote: Compassion hurts. When you feel connected to everything, you also feel responsible for everything. And you cannot turn away. Your destiny is bound with the destinies of others. You must either learn to carry the Universe or be crushed by it. You must grow strong enough to love the world, yet empty enough to sit down at the same table with its worst horrors.
author: Andrew  Boyd, Daily Afflictions: The Agony of Being Connected to Everything in the Universe
tags: compassion, destiny, empathy, pain, universe

quote: Let me not pray to be sheltered from dangers,but to be fearless in facing them. Let me not beg for the stilling of my pain, butfor the heart to conquer it.
author: Rabindranath Tagore, Collected Poems and Plays of Rabindranath Tagore
tags: danger, fearlessness, pain, perseverance

quote: Waiting hurts. Forgetting hurts. But not knowing which decision to take can sometimes be the most painful...
author: José N. Harris, MI VIDA: A Story of Faith, Hope and Love
tags: decision-making, decisions, pain, waiting

quote: I always hated when my scars started to fade, because as long as I could still see them, I knew why I was hurting.
author: Jodi Picoult, Handle with Care
tags: pain

quote: The cure for pain is in the pain.
author: Jalaluddin Rumi
tags: pain

quote: I could never hurt him enough to make his betrayal stop hurting. And it hurts, in every part of my body.
author: Veronica Roth, Insurgent
tags: betrayal, hurt, pain, trust

quote: Most misunderstandings in the world could be avoided if people would simply take the time to ask, "What else could this mean?
author: Shannon L. Alder
tags: anger, ego, misinterpretation, misunderstand, misunderstandings, overthinking, pain, perception, perspective, questions, reading-into-everything, reading-into-things, second-quessing, self-esteem, self-improvement

quote: Memories are bullets. Some whiz by and only spook you. Others tear you open and leave you in pieces.
author: Richard Kadrey, Kill the Dead
tags: bullets, memories, metaphor, pain

quote: These pains you feel are messengers. Listen to them.
author: Jalaluddin Rumi, The Essential Rumi
tags: pain

quote: It isn’t right to wish pain on other people just because they hurt me first.
author: Veronica Roth, Divergent
tags: pain

quote: Being with her I feel a pain, like a frozen knife stuck in my chest. An awful pain, but the funny thing is I'm thankful for it. It's like that frozen pain and my very existence ar
author: Haruki Murakami, Kafka on the Shore
tags: love, pain

quote: Pain is only what you allow it to be
author: Cassandra Clare, City of Ashes
tags: pain

quote: When pain brings you down, don't be silly, don't close your eyes and cry, you just might be in the best position to see the sun shine.
author: Alanis Morissette
tags: cry, eyes, pain, shine, silly, song-lyrics, sun

quote: If you are silent about your pain, they’ll kill you and say you enjoyed it.
author: Zora Neale Hurston
tags: pain, voice

quote: The unending paradox is that we do learn through pain.
author: Madeleine L'Engle
tags: pain

quote: If you can learn to endure pain, you can survive anything. Some people learn to embrace it- to love it. Some endure it through drowning it in sorrow, or by making themselves forget. Others turn it into anger.
author: Sarah J. Maas, The Assassin's Blade
tags: celaena, endurance, pain
